title: Seemingly the only people that get "possessed" by demons and jinn are people who believe in them, so by no longer believing in them, you would no longer get possessed

author: Deadpool604
text: I disagree based on my personal experiences. I never believed in posessions demons jinns or ghosts for that matter. I did not completely discount them but I was confident that these people suffered from mental illness or were bored and just wanted to concoct stories and scenarios that people found interesting and fun. I was sure many were liars and exaggerated. I don't want to discuss my personal experiences but I will say this I do not discount these things and the only real proof that you could have is to be possessed or under the control of a telepath or spirits that being said I am sure that it is real.

author: freed0m_from_th0ught
text:
> the only real proof that you could have is to be possessed or under the control of a telepath

No offense, but this is nonsense. I would go into it more but you don't want to discuss your persona experiences, which is the only way to look into this farther. In the meantime let me say that the only real proof that you could have that Santa is real is to see him putting presents under your tree.

author: Deadpool604
text: I guess I was wrong in that statement you could be a telepath or a ghost so there could be another way that you would know.

author: Deadpool604
text: The only reason I resumed eating was an ultimatum my Doctor gave me stop the sideshow and resume eating or experience excruciating pain from an injection. I chose to resume eating.

author: Deadpool604
text: I really have been under the control of an external force that could be a telepath a demon a spirit or a ghost conflicting deities in my body if you will. The phenomenon was witnessed at UBC in Vancouver where I went 94 days without consuming solid food and drank energy drinks, coca cola I also had ginger ale and coffee. 54 days under confinement I am backed up by my claim due to the fact that I did not defecate the whole entire time under observation (it takes time to reach this point where your body does not expel feces it took 40 days) also unless you are acussing me of lying the voice caused me to perform a miracle in front of groups of onlookers numerous times one was summoning rain in front of a group of people weather manipulation they all looked up to see if there was a plane flying overhead or a crane all the people that witnessed that are probably getting mocked and made fun of like you are mocking me. I don't mind the truth is the truth and it is that which I always stand for no matter how ridiculous it sounds.

author: [deleted]
text:
Do you have documentation of your stay? Maybe before & after pictures? A journal? Anything of your stay in UBC where you weren't eating anything and only drinking energy drinks & coke?

What about the onlookers who saw your miracles can they confirm your story? Any who would be willing to go "yup I saw deadpool604 summon rain on a cloudless sunny day"

I don't mean to be insulting or discount this but have you been checked for schizophrenia?

author: Deadpool604
text: I was walking to work and did not want to engage the onlookers in conversation. Why so what? It was not a cloudless sunny day it was somber so perhaps it was just a coincidence it began to rain the moment it did. Believe what you want. But the other experiences I am keeping to myself.

author: [deleted]
text:
What about the first example you offered? You not eating anything for 40 days at UBC. You said you were under observation unless I misread yea? I get not wanting to share medical stuff but did you keep a journal or anything?

I mean with water one can generally live without food for like 2 months but you said you were only drinking energy drinks and coca cola.

I think you understand that it raining on a somber day isn't a "miracle" in anyway.

And again I mean no disrespect but it really sounds like schizophrenia or something to me but I'm just a random on the internet so who knows

author: Deadpool604
text: No disrespect taken perhaps the potassium in the coke kept me alive. It was 94 days Suffice it to say we will conclude our conversation now I have nothing to gain by proving this but much to lose farewell.

author: Deadpool604
text: I will say this people who have miracles performed for them become mocked ridiculed often times persecuted killed and their social group shuns them or thinks they are childish or a liar so I don't talk much about this.

author: kyl3th3krak3n
text: Only god can perform miracles

author: Deadpool604
text: You think if google was not invented and David Blaine bite into a metal coin and reformed it before people's eyes and claimed he was magneto and performed a miracle. Then instructed them to stand in front of a firing squad because he could stop the bullets. There are many people that would do that wholeheartedly thinking that he could.

author: freed0m_from_th0ught
text:
First off, I want to say I do not want to mock you, nor was that my intention. I am critical of your claim that the only way to know something is true to experience it yourself. I gave a ridiculous example to demonstrate that the argument was ridiculous, not that you or your experience is ridiculous and you should not be mocked. I apologize for coming across in that way.

Thank you for sharing your experience. May I ask a few questions regarding it. You said you did not eat solid food for 94 days, right? You say the miracle you performed was to summon rain. How did you do that? The group of people watching, were they part of this 94 day fast as well?

author: Deadpool604
text: No the group of people that observed this were a group of Doctors in a psychiatric facility under a controlled setting I was brought there due to screaming and acting in an erratic manner that was deemed threatening. They offered me food and juice but I refused. The miracle of summoning rain came when I was compelled to shout out and exclaim in front of a large group of onlookers that it would rain.

author: freed0m_from_th0ught
text:
After long periods of time without solid food, what do we know about the reliability of our mental states? How did you rule out the often hallucinatory effects of being undernourished?

Not to discount your claim of a miracle, but do you find the claim that it will rain to be extraordinary? My mother is very good at knowing when it will rain. Before rain, she will often say, "it's going to rain" and soon after, it will. But there is nothing miraculous about that claim. Without any other information, how would you explain how my mother often knows it will rain before it does?

author: Deadpool604
text: I don't want to discuss this any further your personal beliefs are your own even if someone showed you a miracle you would arrive at some logical explanation for it miracles do nothing for the skeptical mind. Perhaps you are right and it is mental illness. Suffice it to say we will conclude this conversation here.

author: freed0m_from_th0ught
text: Ok. Nobody can force your to continue. At no point did I make the claim of mental illness, but it is important that we rule that out as well before we accept claims of demons. I appreciate you sharing your experience and wish you all the best.

author: Deadpool604
text: Thank you Freed0m. I don't know what it was but it is benovelent in nature towards me but seemed antagonistic in nature towards others it projected my subconscious bias that I repress this was not coming from inside of me it was definitely an external presence.

author: Deadpool604
text: Doctors chart everything in a psychiatric facility so ask them.

author: Deadpool604
text: My body was overcome with a feeling of euphoria. That felt very good. I would call the energy benovelent.

author: thewoogier
text: Did you or the demon write this?

author: Deadpool604
text: I retain full control of my faculties and I would not call it necessarily a demon it seems benevolent at times.

author: thewoogier
text: That's exactly what a malevolent entity who took control of someone would say

author: Deadpool604
text: Maybe but I know myself and my soul remains intact.

author: Tripanes
text: Have you ever seen a doctor about possibly having schizophrenia?

author: Deadpool604
text: I am under the care of a mental health team. Thanks for your concern.

author: Deadpool604
text: You saying all those people that witnessed these strange occurences around Vancouver have schizophrenia?

author: Tripanes
text: I'm saying you seem to have many of the traits of the way they talk on the Internet.

author: Deadpool604
text: This is my outlet I would rather remain anonymous and not disclose this to people in person I hope you understand why.

author: Tripanes
text:
In the hypothetical case that you are schizophrenic, then, I'd refrain talking about these subjects because that would be the cause of your experiences.

If not, of course, then it doesn't matter.  I'd probably think you're either lying or being fooled in some way.

author: Deadpool604
text: Think what you want it makes no difference to me.

author: Combosingelnation
text: How would you test if you were possessed, or you were wrong and it was a mental problem?

author: Deadpool604
text: Mental problems don't manifest physical phenomenon for everyone to see and witness as well. If it is in my head why is it that people see and hear the same things that the voices say are about to happen around me.

author: Combosingelnation
text:
>Mental problems don't manifest physical phenomenon for everyone to see and witness as well.

I'm sorry, I don't understand. I think all mental problems affects us physically. Just some less and some more (some would count as manifesting physical phenomenon, some not).



>If it is in my head why is it that people see and hear the same things that the voices say are about to happen around me.

So when that something wasn't in your head, isn't it logical that others would hear this too? I think the question remains: whatever it is, how would you test if this is demonic possession?

author: Deadpool604
text: Stop calling the entity a demon. I have nothing to gain from sharing these insights with you but much to lose. If you are satisfied with mental illness as your explanation I have nothing to prove here. I can tell you that no eating not drinking and laying in a bed for 3 days straight in a controlled environment with no forced air and experiencing visions and other types of knowledge that I did not have is not normal. The voice possess me to scream out it is too rain and it does immediately for everyone to see. I have a lot more evidence than that what I see and what I hear is what everyone else perceives.

author: Combosingelnation
text:
Sorry, I don't want to bring back bad memories.

Just know that as this is a debate subreddit, people are asking questions and asking you to support your claims.

Sorry again.

author: Deadpool604
text: Matthew 12:26 If Satan casts out Satan he will be divided against himself how will his kingdom stand? That line in the Vietnamese bible states I am not a demon but I will use demonic energy to defeat my opponent. Whether a being is a demon or not is a matter of opinion I guess.

author: Deadpool604
text: It was not a bad memory It was one of the most pleasurable experiences I have ever had. I believed immediately afterwards.

author: Deadpool604
text: I don't want to scare people or upset them. But perhaps you will allow the possibility of these truths to be something that you will not dismiss and ridicule people over then that is a positive outcome.

author: Combosingelnation
text: I don't ridicule. I am an ex-Christian and I know very well how indoctrination or appealing to one's emotions works.

author: Deadpool604
text: I understand how evil and manipulative religion can be. I was born Roman Catholic but barely went to church and did not have a lifestyle that was congruent with all the bible's teachings I was very good natured though and had a pretty strong moral compass I only read the bible 2-3 years ago and I am 39 now. I don't believe people can be eternally damned as long as free will is still an aspect of man. Have a good day and thanks for listening.
